text:
Phoenix Park Honey Show attracts bee lovers Published on : Monday, September 14, 2015
Minister Simon Harris attended the inaugural Phoenix Park Honey Show at the Phoenix Park Visitor Centre.
Presenting the awards at the event, Minister Harris stated ” I wish to welcome beekeepers and beekeeping enthusiasts to the wonderful Phoenix Park on the occasion of the inaugural ‘Phoenix Park Honey Show’ and I would like to thank FIBKA (Federation of Irish Beekeepers’ Associations) for inviting my Office, the Office of Public Works, to host the Show. It is a great honour for the OPW to be involved in this event helping to promote the importance of the honeybee”.
Over the past number of years, there has been a serious decline in the honeybee population worldwide and great efforts are being made by countries to protect the honeybee. The threat comes from many sources including insecticides, pesticides, weather and man, to name a few.
Minister Harris added ” What better place than in this wonderful Park, with its considerable range of habitats and walled gardens, for the location of hives, which help to sustain the high biodiversity value of the park for future generations. The new wildflower meadow in the walled garden here at the Visitor Centre, has become a haven for our honeybees, our butterflies and moths, never mind the birds that will feast on its plentiful harvest. I was very interested to learn that one bee can pollinate up to 1000 flowers per day and the estimated value of bee pollination is worth €57 million to the Irish economy”.
Minister Harris concluded ” Next Spring, my Office, hopes to hold beekeeping classes here in the Visitor Centre in association with the County Dublin Beekeepers Association and I have no doubt that, judging from the attendance and enthusiasm here today, there will be no shortage of interest in learning more about the wonderful world of the honeybee”.
